org.apache.cocoon.transformation
Class HtmlMailTransformer

java.lang.Object
  AbstractSAXTransformer
      org.apache.cocoon.transformation.HtmlMailTransformer

public class HtmlMailTransformer
extends AbstractSAXTransformer

This Transformer is capable of sending emails with inline images, but without attachments. You may parameterize it in several ways. In the map:sitemap/map:components/map:transformers declaration: 

 <map:transformer name="mail" src="org.apache.cocoon.transformation.HtmlMailTransformer" >
   <smtphost>localhost</smtphost>
   <smtpport>25</smtpport>
   <from-address>someone@somehost.nl</from-address>
 </map:transformer>
smtphost
Optional. The host name or IP address of your SMTP host, default is 'localhost'.
smtpport
Optional. The SMTP port, default is 25.
user
Optional. The user to authenticate to the SMTP server. Default is no user.
password
Optional. The password for the SMTP user. Default is no password.
from-address
Optional. The email address of the sender. Default is no address.
The HtmlMailTransformer may be used in a pipeline without parameters: 
 <map:transform type="mail"/>
Optionally, the following sitemap parameters can be used:
smtphost
Optional. The host name or IP address of your SMTP host, overrides the component-configuration setting.
smtpport
Optional. The SMTP port, overrides the component-configuration setting.
from-address
Optional. The email address of the sender, overrides the component-configuration setting.
image-base-uri
Optional. The base-uri of included images, defaults to none (use absolute paths).
The input document should contain one or more <mail> elements in the "http://apache.org/cocoon/transformation/sendmail" namespace. Example: 
 <mail:mail to="recipient@somedomain.com" xmlns:mail="http://apache.org/cocoon/transformation/sendmail">
   <html>
     <body>
       <b>Place the html-content of the email inside the mail-element.</b>
     </body>
   </html>
 </mail>
The <mail> element has the following attributes:
to
Required. The email address of the recipient of the email.
subject
Required. The subject of the email.
image-base-uri
Optional. The base-uri of included images, overrides the setting in the sitemap parameter.
The result of applying this transformer is a or element in the "http://apache.org/cocoon/transformation/sendmail" namespace. If an error occurred, the error element has the 'to' and 'subject' attributes of the original element, plus a 'reason' attribute, which may be:
failed
Sending mail failed for no specific reason.
The error message is in the content of the error element. The message and stacktrace will be logged.
